Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2015 08:22PM Ashley46 wrote: hi all, thanks for all the advise. I hv cancelled my surgery scheduled for tomorrow and will do a second opinion . My doctor has given me a reference letter and this is what it says Mammogram showed multiple clusters of microcalcification in the right breast while ultrasound showed several ill defined solid lesions from 2 oclock to 10 oclock in the right breast. Clinically there was a diffuse lump in the upper half of the right breast. No axillary lymph nodes were felt. A diagnosis of multifocal breast cancer was made, and this was confirmed by an ultrasound guided core needle biopsy of 2 of the lumps at 10 oclock and 2 oclock, which showed a high grade infiltrating ductal carcinoma Not sure what stage and how bad it is.... Ashley

Posts.Content: Oct 5, 2016 04:46AM Ashley46 wrote: Hi Everyone, Its been sometime since I logged in. Hows everyone doing? Its been 10 months and lots have happened. I am feeling better than when it all started. Right mastec and tram flap recon was done in Jan, it was a difficult period for a month and then in Feb I started on 4 cycles of chemo, TC. Completed chemo in May and am now on tamoxifen. Have returned back to Melbourne and currently with a Breast surgeon and Onco here. Thank you so much for being with me during my lowest time, your supports made things easier...thank you all. Ashley xxx
